title: Advanced Radiographic Image Interpretation Education: Linear vs. Branching Tutorial Comparison

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Practitioner-oriented, hands-on curriculum considering work applicability, conducted in a personal device (BYOD) environment.

learning_goals: Learners can identify key abnormal findings in cervical spine radiographs with over 85% accuracy.
Learners can achieve at least 15% time efficiency by selecting either a linear or branched tutorial that suits their learning style.
Learners can write a clinical case analysis report through project-based assessment.

resources: Online collaboration platforms (e.g., Notion, Google Workspace)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
